981  //============================================================================
982  // Method Description:
994  template<typename dtype>
995  bool allclose(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2, double inTolerance)
996  {
997  if (inArray1.shape() != inArray2.shape())
998  {
999  std::string errStr = "ERROR: allclose: input array dimensions are not consistant.";
1000  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1001  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1002  }
1003 
1004  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray1.size(); ++i)
1005  {
1006  if (std::abs(inArray1[i] - inArray2[i]) > inTolerance)
1007  {
1008  return false;
1009  }
1010  }
1011 
1012  return true;
1013  }

1066  //============================================================================
1067  // Method Description:
1080  template<typename dtype>
1081  NdArray<dtype> append(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inAppendValues, Axis inAxis)
1082  {
1083  switch (inAxis)
1084  {
1085  case Axis::NONE:
1086  {
1087  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() + inAppendValues.size());
1088  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
1089  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(), inAppendValues.cend(), returnArray.begin() + inArray.size());
1090 
1091  return std::move(returnArray);
1092  }
1093  case Axis::ROW:
1094  {
1095  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
1096  Shape appendShape = inAppendValues.shape();
1097  if (inShape.cols != appendShape.cols)
1098  {
1099  std::string errStr = "ERROR: append: all the input array dimensions except for the concatenation axis must match exactly";
1100  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1101  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1102  }
1103 
1104  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows + appendShape.rows, inShape.cols);
1105  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
1106  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(), inAppendValues.cend(), returnArray.begin() + inArray.size());
1107 
1108  return std::move(returnArray);
1109  }
1110  case Axis::COL:
1111  {
1112  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
1113  Shape appendShape = inAppendValues.shape();
1114  if (inShape.rows != appendShape.rows)
1115  {
1116  std::string errStr = "ERROR: append: all the input array dimensions except for the concatenation axis must match exactly";
1117  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1118  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1119  }
1120 
1121  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, inShape.cols + appendShape.cols);
1122  for (uint32 row = 0; row < returnArray.shape().rows; ++row)
1123  {
1124  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), returnArray.begin(row));
1125  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(row), inAppendValues.cend(row), returnArray.begin(row) + inShape.cols);
1126  }
1127 
1128  return std::move(returnArray);
1129  }
1130  default:
1131  {
1132  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
1133  // of the compiler warning.
1134  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
1135  }
1136  }
1137  }
1138 
1139  //============================================================================
1140  // Method Description:
1159  template<typename dtype>
1160  NdArray<dtype> arange(dtype inStart, dtype inStop, dtype inStep)
1161  {
1162  if (inStep > 0 && inStop < inStart)
1163  {
1164  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: stop value must be larger than the start value for positive step.";
1165  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1166  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1167  }
1168 
1169  if (inStep < 0 && inStop > inStart)
1170  {
1171  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: start value must be larger than the stop value for negative step.";
1172  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1173  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1174  }
1175 
1176  std::vector<dtype> values;
1177 
1178  dtype theValue = inStart;
1179 
1180  if (inStep > 0)
1181  {
1182  while (theValue < inStop)
1183  {
1184  values.push_back(theValue);
1185  theValue += static_cast<dtype>(inStep);
1186  }
1187  }
1188  else
1189  {
1190  while (theValue > inStop)
1191  {
1192  values.push_back(theValue);
1193  theValue += static_cast<dtype>(inStep);
1194  }
1195  }
1196 
1197  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
1198  }
1199 
1200  //============================================================================
1201  // Method Description:
1219  template<typename dtype>
1220  NdArray<dtype> arange(dtype inStop)
1221  {
1222  if (inStop <= 0)
1223  {
1224  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: stop value must ge greater than 0.";
1225  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1226  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1227  }
1228 
1229  return std::move(arange<dtype>(0, inStop, 1));
1230  }

1726  //============================================================================
1727  // Method Description:
1738  template<typename dtype>
1739  NdArray<double> average(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inWeights, Axis inAxis)
1740  {
1741  switch (inAxis)
1742  {
1743  case Axis::NONE:
1744  {
1745  if (inWeights.shape() != inArray.shape())
1746  {
1747  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weight values are not consistant.";
1748  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1749  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1750  }
1751 
1752  NdArray<double> weightedArray(inArray.shape());
1753  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), inWeights.cbegin(), weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1754 
1755  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1756  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum /= inWeights.template sum<double>().item() };
1757 
1758  return std::move(returnArray);
1759  }
1760  case Axis::COL:
1761  {
1762  Shape arrayShape = inArray.shape();
1763  if (inWeights.size() != arrayShape.cols)
1764  {
1765  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weights value are not consistant.";
1766  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1767  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1768  }
1769 
1770  double weightSum = inWeights.template sum<double>().item();
1771  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, arrayShape.rows);
1772  for (uint32 row = 0; row < arrayShape.rows; ++row)
1773  {
1774  NdArray<double> weightedArray(1, arrayShape.cols);
1775  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), inWeights.cbegin(), weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1776 
1777  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1778  returnArray(0, row) = sum / weightSum;
1779  }
1780 
1781  return std::move(returnArray);
1782  }
1783  case Axis::ROW:
1784  {
1785  if (inWeights.size() != inArray.shape().rows)
1786  {
1787  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weight values are not consistant.";
1788  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1789  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1790  }
1791 
1792  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
1793 
1794  Shape transShape = transposedArray.shape();
1795  double weightSum = inWeights.template sum<double>().item();
1796  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, transShape.rows);
1797  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
1798  {
1799  NdArray<double> weightedArray(1, transShape.cols);
1800  std::transform(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), inWeights.cbegin(), weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1801 
1802  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1803  returnArray(0, row) = sum / weightSum;
1804  }
1805 
1806  return std::move(returnArray);
1807  }
1808  default:
1809  {
1810  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
1811  // of the compiler warning.
1812  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
1813  }
1814  }
1815  }
1816 
1817  //============================================================================
1818  // Method Description:
1835  template<typename dtype>
1836  NdArray<dtype> bincount(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint16 inMinLength)
1837  {
1838  // only works with integer input types
1839  static_assert(DtypeInfo<dtype>::isInteger(), "ERROR: bincount: can only use with integer types.");
1840 
1841  dtype maxValue = inArray.max().item();
1842  if (maxValue < 0)
1843  {
1844  // no positive values so just return an empty array
1845  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
1846  }
1847 
1848  if (maxValue + 1 > DtypeInfo<dtype>::max())
1849  {
1850  std::string errStr = "Error: bincount: array values too large, will result in gigantic array that will take up alot of memory...";
1851  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1852  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1853  }
1854 
1855  uint16 outArraySize = std::max(static_cast<uint16>(maxValue + 1), inMinLength);
1856  NdArray<dtype> clippedArray = inArray.clip(0, maxValue);
1857 
1858  NdArray<dtype> outArray(1, outArraySize);
1859  outArray.zeros();
1860  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
1861  {
1862  ++outArray[clippedArray[i]];
1863  }
1864 
1865  return std::move(outArray);
1866  }
1867 
1868  //============================================================================
1869  // Method Description:
1889  template<typename dtype>
1890  NdArray<dtype> bincount(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inWeights, uint16 inMinLength)
1891  {
1892  // only works with integer input types
1893  static_assert(DtypeInfo<dtype>::isInteger(), "ERROR: bincount: can only use with integer types.");
1894 
1895  if (inArray.shape() != inWeights.shape())
1896  {
1897  std::string errStr = "ERROR: bincount: weights array must be the same shape as the input array.";
1898  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1899  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1900  }
1901 
1902  dtype maxValue = inArray.max().item();
1903  if (maxValue < 0)
1904  {
1905  // no positive values so just return an empty array
1906  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
1907  }
1908 
1909  if (maxValue + 1 > DtypeInfo<dtype>::max())
1910  {
1911  std::string errStr = "Error: bincount: array values too large, will result in gigantic array that will take up alot of memory...";
1912  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1913  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1914  }
1915 
1916  uint16 outArraySize = std::max(static_cast<uint16>(maxValue + 1), inMinLength);
1917  NdArray<dtype> clippedArray = inArray.clip(0, maxValue);
1918 
1919  NdArray<dtype> outArray(1, outArraySize);
1920  outArray.zeros();
1921  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
1922  {
1923  outArray[clippedArray[i]] += inWeights[i];
1924  }
1925 
1926  return std::move(outArray);
1927  }

2120  //============================================================================
2121  // Method Description:
2131  template<typename dtype>
2132  NdArray<dtype> column_stack(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList)
2133  {
2134  // first loop through to calculate the final size of the array
2135  typename std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >::iterator iter;
2136  Shape finalShape;
2137  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2138  {
2139  if (finalShape.isnull())
2140  {
2141  finalShape = iter->shape();
2142  }
2143  else if (iter->shape().rows != finalShape.rows)
2144  {
2145  std::string errStr = "ERROR: column_stack: input arrays must have the same number of rows.";
2146  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2147  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2148  }
2149  else
2150  {
2151  finalShape.cols += iter->shape().cols;
2152  }
2153  }
2154 
2155  // now that we know the final size, contruct the output array
2156  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(finalShape);
2157  uint32 colStart = 0;
2158  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2159  {
2160  Shape theShape = iter->shape();
2161  for (uint32 row = 0; row < theShape.rows; ++row)
2162  {
2163  for (uint32 col = 0; col < theShape.cols; ++col)
2164  {
2165  returnArray(row, colStart + col) = iter->operator()(row, col);
2166  }
2167  }
2168  colStart += theShape.cols;
2169  }
2170 
2171  return std::move(returnArray);
2172  }
2173 
2174  //============================================================================
2175  // Method Description:
2185  template<typename dtype>
2186  NdArray<dtype> concatenate(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList, Axis inAxis)
2187  {
2188  switch (inAxis)
2189  {
2190  case Axis::NONE:
2191  {
2192  uint32 finalSize = 0;
2193  typename std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >::iterator iter;
2194  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2195  {
2196  finalSize += iter->size();
2197  }
2198 
2199  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, finalSize);
2200  uint32 offset = 0;
2201  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2202  {
2203  std::copy(iter->cbegin(), iter->cend(), returnArray.begin() + offset);
2204  offset += iter->size();
2205  }
2206 
2207  return std::move(returnArray);
2208  }
2209  case Axis::ROW:
2210  {
2211  return std::move(row_stack(inArrayList));
2212  }
2213  case Axis::COL:
2214  {
2215  return std::move(column_stack(inArrayList));
2216  }
2217  default:
2218  {
2219  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2220  // of the compiler warning.
2221  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2222  }
2223  }
2224  }

2379  //============================================================================
2380  // Method Description:
2390  template<typename dtype>
2391  NdArray<uint32> count_nonzero(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
2392  {
2393  switch (inAxis)
2394  {
2395  case Axis::NONE:
2396  {
2397  NdArray<uint32> count = { inArray.nonzero().size() };
2398  return count;
2399  }
2400  case Axis::COL:
2401  {
2402  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2403

2405  returnArray.zeros();

2407  {
2408  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2409  {
2410  if (inArray(row, col) != static_cast<dtype>(0))
2411  {
2412  ++returnArray(0, row);
2413  }
2414  }
2415  }
2416 
2417  return std::move(returnArray);
2418  }
2419  case Axis::ROW:
2420  {
2421  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2422 
2423  NdArray<uint32> returnArray(1, inShape.cols);
2424  returnArray.zeros();
2425  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2426  {
2427  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2428  {
2429  if (inArray(row, col) != static_cast<dtype>(0))
2430  {
2431  ++returnArray(0, col);
2432  }
2433  }
2434  }
2435 
2436  return std::move(returnArray);
2437  }
2438  default:
2439  {
2440  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2441  // of the compiler warning.
2442  return std::move(NdArray<uint32>(0));
2443  }
2444  }
2445  }

2447  //============================================================================
2448  // Method Description:
2459  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
2460  NdArray<dtypeOut> cross(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2, Axis inAxis)
2461  {
2462  if (inArray1.shape() != inArray2.shape())
2463  {
2464  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: the input array dimensions are not consistant.";
2465  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2466  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2467  }
2468 
2469  switch (inAxis)
2470  {
2471  case Axis::NONE:
2472  {
2473  uint32 arraySize = inArray1.size();
2474  if (arraySize != inArray2.size() || arraySize < 2 || arraySize > 3)
2475  {
2476  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2477  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2478  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2479  }
2480 
2481  NdArray<dtype> in1 = inArray1.flatten();
2482  NdArray<dtype> in2 = inArray2.flatten();
2483 
2484  switch (arraySize)
2485  {
2486  case 2:
2487  {
2488  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1])
2489  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]) };
2490  return std::move(returnArray);
2491  }
2492  case 3:
2493  {
2494  dtypeOut i = static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[2])
2495  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[2]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1]);
2496  dtypeOut j = -(static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[2])
2497  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[2]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]));
2498  dtypeOut k = (static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1])
2499  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]));
2500 
2501  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { i, j, k };
2502  return std::move(returnArray);
2503  }
2504  default:
2505  {
2506  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2507  // of the compiler warning.
2508  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
2509  }
2510  }
2511  }
2512  case Axis::ROW:
2513  {
2514  Shape arrayShape = inArray1.shape();
2515  if (arrayShape != inArray2.shape() || arrayShape.rows < 2 || arrayShape.rows > 3)
2516  {
2517  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2518  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2519  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2520  }
2521 
2522  Shape returnArrayShape;
2523  if (arrayShape.rows == 2)
2524  {
2525  returnArrayShape = Shape(1, arrayShape.cols);
2526  }
2527  else
2528  {
2529  returnArrayShape = Shape(3, arrayShape.cols);
2530  }
2531 
2532  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(returnArrayShape);
2533  for (uint32 col = 0; col < arrayShape.cols; ++col)
2534  {
2535  int32 theCol = static_cast<int32>(col);
2536  NdArray<dtype> vec1 = inArray1({ 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 });
2537  NdArray<dtype> vec2 = inArray2({ 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 });
2538  NdArray<dtypeOut> vecCross = cross<dtypeOut>(vec1, vec2, Axis::NONE);
2539 
2540  returnArray.put({ 0, static_cast<int32>(returnArrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 }, vecCross);
2541  }
2542 
2543  return std::move(returnArray);
2544  }
2545  case Axis::COL:
2546  {
2547  Shape arrayShape = inArray1.shape();
2548  if (arrayShape != inArray2.shape() || arrayShape.cols < 2 || arrayShape.cols > 3)
2549  {
2550  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2551  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2552  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2553  }
2554 
2555  Shape returnArrayShape;
2556  if (arrayShape.cols == 2)
2557  {
2558  returnArrayShape = Shape(arrayShape.rows, 1);
2559  }
2560  else
2561  {
2562  returnArrayShape = Shape(arrayShape.rows, 3);
2563  }
2564 
2565  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(returnArrayShape);
2566  for (uint32 row = 0; row < arrayShape.rows; ++row)
2567  {
2568  int32 theRow = static_cast<int32>(row);
2569  NdArray<dtype> vec1 = inArray1({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.cols) });
2570  NdArray<dtype> vec2 = inArray2({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.cols) });
2571  NdArray<dtypeOut> vecCross = cross<dtypeOut>(vec1, vec2, Axis::NONE);
2572 
2573  returnArray.put({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(returnArrayShape.cols) }, vecCross);
2574  }
2575 
2576  return std::move(returnArray);
2577  }
2578  default:
2579  {
2580  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2581  // of the compiler warning.
2582  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
2583  }
2584  }
2585  }
2586

2600  }

2691  //============================================================================
2692  // Method Description:
2701  template<typename dtype>
2702  NdArray<dtype> deleteIndices(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<uint32>& inArrayIdxs, Axis inAxis)
2703  {
2704  // make sure that the indices are unique first
2705  NdArray<uint32> indices = unique(inArrayIdxs);
2706 
2707  switch (inAxis)
2708  {
2709  case Axis::NONE:
2710  {
2711  std::vector<dtype> values;
2712  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
2713  {
2714  if (indices.contains(i).item())
2715  {
2716  continue;
2717  }
2718 
2719  values.push_back(inArray[i]);
2720  }
2721 
2722  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
2723  }
2724  case Axis::ROW:
2725  {
2726  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2727  if (indices.max().item() >= inShape.rows)
2728  {
2729  std::string errStr = "ERROR: deleteIndices: input index value is greater than the number of rows in the array.";
2730  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2731  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2732  }
2733 
2734  uint32 numNewRows = inShape.rows - indices.size();
2735  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(numNewRows, inShape.cols);
2736 
2737  uint32 rowCounter = 0;
2738  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2739  {
2740  if (indices.contains(row).item())
2741  {
2742  continue;
2743  }
2744 
2745  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2746  {
2747  returnArray(rowCounter, col) = inArray(row, col);
2748  }
2749  ++rowCounter;
2750  }
2751 
2752  return std::move(returnArray);
2753  }
2754  case Axis::COL:
2755  {
2756  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2757  if (indices.max().item() >= inShape.cols)
2758  {
2759  std::string errStr = "ERROR: deleteIndices: input index value is greater than the number of cols in the array.";
2760  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2761  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2762  }
2763 
2764  uint32 numNewCols = inShape.cols - indices.size();
2765  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, numNewCols);
2766 
2767  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2768  {
2769  uint32 colCounter = 0;
2770  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2771  {
2772  if (indices.contains(col).item())
2773  {
2774  continue;
2775  }
2776 
2777  returnArray(row, colCounter++) = inArray(row, col);
2778  }
2779  }
2780 
2781  return std::move(returnArray);
2782 
2783 
2784  }
2785  default:
2786  {
2787  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2788  // of the compiler warning.
2789  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2790  }
2791  }
2792  }
2793 
2794  //============================================================================
2795  // Method Description:
2804  template<typename dtype>
2805  NdArray<dtype> deleteIndices(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const Slice& inIndicesSlice, Axis inAxis)
2806  {
2807  Slice sliceCopy(inIndicesSlice);
2808 
2809  switch (inAxis)
2810  {
2811  case Axis::NONE:
2812  {
2813  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.size());
2814  break;
2815  }
2816  case Axis::ROW:
2817  {
2818  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.shape().cols);
2819  break;
2820  }
2821  case Axis::COL:
2822  {
2823  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.shape().rows);
2824  break;
2825  }
2826  }
2827 
2828  std::vector<uint32> indices;
2829  for (uint32 i = static_cast<uint32>(sliceCopy.start); i < static_cast<uint32>(sliceCopy.stop); i += sliceCopy.step)
2830  {
2831  indices.push_back(i);
2832  }
2833 
2834  return std::move(deleteIndices(inArray, NdArray<uint32>(indices), inAxis));
2835  }
2836

2838  // Method Description:
2847  template<typename dtype>
2848  NdArray<dtype> deleteIndices(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint32 inIndex, Axis inAxis)
2849  {
2850  NdArray<uint32> inIndices = { inIndex };
2851  return std::move(deleteIndices(inArray, inIndices, inAxis));
2852  }

2897  // Method Description:
2908  template<typename dtype>
2909  NdArray<dtype> diff(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
2910  {
2911  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2912 
2913  switch (inAxis)
2914  {
2915  case Axis::NONE:
2916  {
2917  if (inArray.size() < 2)
2918  {
2919  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2920  }
2921 
2922  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() - 1);
2923  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend() - 1, inArray.cbegin() + 1, returnArray.begin(),
2924  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
2925 
2926  return std::move(returnArray);
2927  }
2928  case Axis::COL:
2929  {
2930  if (inShape.cols < 2)
2931  {
2932  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2933  }
2934 
2935  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, inShape.cols - 1);
2936  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2937  {
2938  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row) - 1, inArray.cbegin(row) + 1, returnArray.begin(row),
2939  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
2940  }
2941 
2942  return std::move(returnArray);
2943  }
2944  case Axis::ROW:
2945  {
2946  if (inShape.rows < 2)
2947  {
2948  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2949  }
2950 
2951  NdArray<dtype> transArray = inArray.transpose();
2952  Shape transShape = transArray.shape();
2953  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(transShape.rows, transShape.cols - 1);
2954  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
2955  {
2956  std::transform(transArray.cbegin(row), transArray.cend(row) - 1, transArray.cbegin(row) + 1, returnArray.begin(row),
2957  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
2958  }
2959 
2960  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
2961  }
2962  default:
2963  {
2964  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2965  // of the compiler warning.
2966  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2967  }
2968  }
2969  }

3327  template<typename dtype>
3328  NdArray<dtype> eye(uint32 inN, uint32 inM, int32 inK)
3329  {
3330  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inN, inM);
3331  returnArray.zeros();
3332 
3333  if (inK < 0)
3334  {
3335  uint32 col = 0;
3336  for (uint32 row = inK; row < inN; ++row)
3337  {
3338  if (col >= inM)
3339  {
3340  break;
3341  }
3342 
3343  returnArray(row, col++) = 1;
3344  }
3345  }
3346  else
3347  {
3348  uint32 row = 0;
3349  for (uint32 col = inK; col < inM; ++col)
3350  {
3351  if (row >= inN)
3352  {
3353  break;
3354  }
3355 
3356  returnArray(row++, col) = 1;
3357  }
3358  }
3359 
3360  return std::move(returnArray);
3361  }

3465  template<typename dtype>
3466  NdArray<dtype> flip(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
3467  {
3468  switch (inAxis)
3469  {
3470  case Axis::NONE:
3471  {
3472  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
3473  std::reverse(returnArray.begin(), returnArray.end());
3474  return std::move(returnArray);
3475  }
3476  case Axis::COL:
3477  {
3478  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
3479  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inArray.shape().rows; ++row)
3480  {
3481  std::reverse(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.end(row));
3482  }
3483  return std::move(returnArray);
3484  }
3485  case Axis::ROW:
3486  {
3487  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = inArray.transpose();
3488  for (uint32 row = 0; row < returnArray.shape().rows; ++row)
3489  {
3490  std::reverse(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.end(row));
3491  }
3492  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
3493  }
3494  default:
3495  {
3496  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3497  }
3498  }
3499  }

3766  //============================================================================
3767  // Method Description:
3779  template<typename dtype>
3780  NdArray<dtype> fromfile(const std::string& inFilename, const std::string& inSep)
3781  {
3782  boost::filesystem::path p(inFilename);
3783  if (!boost::filesystem::exists(inFilename))
3784  {
3785  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: input filename does not exist.\n\t" + inFilename;
3786  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3787  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3788  }
3789 
3790  if (inSep.compare("") == 0)
3791  {
3792  // read in as binary file
3793  std::ifstream in(inFilename.c_str(), std::ios::in | std::ios::binary);
3794  in.seekg(0, in.end);
3795  uint32 fileSize = static_cast<uint32>(in.tellg());
3796 
3797  FILE* filePtr = fopen(inFilename.c_str(), "rb");
3798  if (filePtr == NULL)
3799  {
3800  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: unable to open the file.";
3801  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3802  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3803  }
3804 
3805  char* fileBuffer = new char[fileSize];
3806  size_t bytesRead = fread(fileBuffer, sizeof(char), fileSize, filePtr);
3807  fclose(filePtr);
3808 
3809  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(reinterpret_cast<dtype*>(fileBuffer), static_cast<uint32>(bytesRead));
3810  delete[] fileBuffer;
3811 
3812  return std::move(returnArray);
3813  }
3814  else
3815  {
3816  // read in as txt file
3817  if (!(inSep.compare(" ") == 0 || inSep.compare("\t") == 0 || inSep.compare("\n") == 0))
3818  {
3819  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: only [' ', '\\t', '\\n'] seperators are supported";
3820  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3821  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3822  }
3823 
3824  std::vector<dtype> values;
3825 
3826  std::ifstream file(inFilename.c_str());
3827  if (file.is_open())
3828  {
3829  while (!file.eof())
3830  {
3831  std::string line;
3832  std::getline(file, line);
3833 
3834  std::istringstream iss(line);
3835  try
3836  {
3837  values.push_back(static_cast<dtype>(std::stod(iss.str())));
3838  }
3839  catch (const std::invalid_argument& ia)
3840  {
3841  std::cout << "Warning: fromfile: " << ia.what() << std::endl;
3843  }
3844  }
3845  file.close();
3846  }
3847  else
3848  {
3849  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: unable to open file.";
3850  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3851  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3852  }
3853 
3854  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
3855  }
3856  }

4011  //============================================================================
4012  // Method Description:
4024  template<typename dtype>
4025  std::pair<NdArray<uint32>, NdArray<double> > histogram(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint32 inNumBins)
4026  {
4027  if (inNumBins == 0)
4028  {
4029  std::string errStr = "ERROR: histogram: number of bins must be positive.";
4030  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4031  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4032  }
4033 
4034  NdArray<uint32> histo = zeros<uint32>(1, inNumBins);
4035 
4036  bool useEndPoint = true;
4037  NdArray<double> binEdges = linspace(static_cast<double>(inArray.min().item()),
4038  static_cast<double>(inArray.max().item()), inNumBins + 1, useEndPoint);
4039 
4040  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
4041  {
4042  // binary search to find the bin idx
4043  bool keepSearching = true;
4044  uint32 lowIdx = 0;
4045  uint32 highIdx = binEdges.size() - 1;
4046  while (keepSearching)
4047  {
4048  uint32 idx = (lowIdx + highIdx) / 2; // integer division
4049  if (lowIdx == highIdx || lowIdx == highIdx - 1)
4050  {
4051  // we found the bin
4052  ++histo[lowIdx];
4053  break;
4054  }
4055 
4056  if (inArray[i] > binEdges[idx])
4057  {
4058  lowIdx = idx;
4059  }
4060  else if (inArray[i] < binEdges[idx])
4061  {
4062  highIdx = idx;
4063  }
4064  else
4065  {
4066  // we found the bin
4067  ++histo[idx];
4068  break;
4069  }
4070  }
4071  }
4072 
4073  return std::move(std::make_pair(histo, binEdges));
4074  }

4191  //============================================================================
4192  // Method Description:
4209  template<typename dtype>
4210  NdArray<dtype> interp(const NdArray<dtype>& inX, const NdArray<dtype>& inXp, const NdArray<dtype>& inFp)
4211  {
4212  // do some error checking first
4213  if (inXp.size() != inFp.size())
4214  {
4215  std::string errStr = "ERROR: interp: inXp and inFp need to be the same size().";
4216  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4217  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4218  }
4219 
4220  if (inX.min().item() < inXp.min().item() || inX.max().item() > inXp.max().item())
4221  {
4222  std::string errStr = "ERROR: interp: endpoints of inX should be contained within inXp.";
4223  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4224  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4225  }
4226 
4227  // sort the input inXp and inFp data
4228  NdArray<uint32> sortedXpIdxs = argsort(inXp);
4229  NdArray<dtype> sortedXp(1, inFp.size());
4230  NdArray<dtype> sortedFp(1, inFp.size());
4231  for (uint32 i = 0; i < sortedXpIdxs.size(); ++i)
4232  {
4233  sortedXp[i] = inXp[sortedXpIdxs[i]];
4234  sortedFp[i] = inFp[sortedXpIdxs[i]];
4235  }
4236 
4237  // sort the input inX array
4238  NdArray<dtype> sortedX = sort(inX);
4239 
4240  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inX.size());
4241 
4242  uint32 currXpIdx = 0;
4243  uint32 currXidx = 0;
4244  while (currXidx < sortedX.size())
4245  {
4246  if (sortedXp[currXpIdx] <= sortedX[currXidx] && sortedX[currXidx] <= sortedXp[currXpIdx + 1])
4247  {
4248  double percent = static_cast<double>(sortedX[currXidx] - sortedXp[currXpIdx]) /
4249  static_cast<double>(sortedXp[currXpIdx + 1] - sortedXp[currXpIdx]);
4250  returnArray[currXidx++] = Utils::interp(sortedFp[currXpIdx], sortedFp[currXpIdx + 1], percent);
4251  }
4252  else
4253  {
4254  ++currXpIdx;
4255  }
4256  }
4257 
4258  return std::move(returnArray);
4259  }
4260 
4261  //============================================================================
4262  // Method Description:
4275  template<typename dtype>
4276  NdArray<dtype> intersect1d(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2)
4277  {
4278  std::vector<dtype> res(inArray1.size() + inArray2.size());
4279  std::set<dtype> in1(inArray1.cbegin(), inArray1.cend());
4280  std::set<dtype> in2(inArray2.cbegin(), inArray2.cend());
4281 
4282  typename std::vector<dtype>::iterator iter = std::set_intersection(in1.begin(), in1.end(),
4283  in2.begin(), in2.end(), res.begin());
4284  res.resize(iter - res.begin());
4285  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(res));
4286  }

4569  //============================================================================
4570  // Method Description:
4591  template<typename dtype>
4592  NdArray<dtype> linspace(dtype inStart, dtype inStop, uint32 inNum, bool endPoint)
4593  {
4594  if (inNum == 0)
4595  {
4596  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
4597  }
4598  else if (inNum == 1)
4599  {
4600  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart };
4601  return std::move(returnArray);
4602  }
4603 
4604  if (inStop <= inStart)
4605  {
4606  std::string errStr = "ERROR: linspace: stop value must be greater than the start value.";
4607  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4608  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4609  }
4610 
4611  if (endPoint)
4612  {
4613  if (inNum == 2)
4614  {
4615  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart, inStop };
4616  return std::move(returnArray);
4617  }
4618  else
4619  {
4620  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inNum);
4621  returnArray[0] = inStart;
4622  returnArray[inNum - 1] = inStop;
4623 
4624  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / (inNum - 1);
4625  for (uint32 i = 1; i < inNum - 1; ++i)
4626  {
4627  returnArray[i] = returnArray[i - 1] + step;
4628  }
4629 
4630  return std::move(returnArray);
4631  }
4632  }
4633  else
4634  {
4635  if (inNum == 2)
4636  {
4637  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / (inNum);
4638  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart, inStart + step };
4639  return std::move(returnArray);
4640  }
4641  else
4642  {
4643  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inNum);
4644  returnArray[0] = inStart;
4645 
4646  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / inNum;
4647  for (uint32 i = 1; i < inNum; ++i)
4648  {
4649  returnArray[i] = returnArray[i - 1] + step;
4650  }
4651 
4652  return std::move(returnArray);
4653  }
4654  }
4655  }

5260  //============================================================================
5261  // Method Description:
5272  template<typename dtype>
5273  NdArray<double> nanmean(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5274  {
5275  switch (inAxis)
5276  {
5277  case Axis::NONE:
5278  {
5279  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), 0.0,
5280  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5281 
5282  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), 0.0,
5283  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5284 
5285  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum /= numberNonNan };
5286 
5287  return std::move(returnArray);
5288  }
5289  case Axis::COL:
5290  {
5291  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5292  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5293  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5294  {
5295  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5296  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5297 
5298  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5299  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5300 
5301  returnArray(0, row) = sum / numberNonNan;
5302  }
5303 
5304  return std::move(returnArray);
5305  }
5306  case Axis::ROW:
5307  {
5308  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5309  Shape transShape = transposedArray.shape();
5310  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, transShape.rows);
5311  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
5312  {
5313  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5314  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5315 
5316  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5317  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5318 
5319  returnArray(0, row) = sum / numberNonNan;
5320  }
5321 
5322  return std::move(returnArray);
5323  }
5324  default:
5325  {
5326  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5327  // of the compiler warning.
5328  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
5329  }
5330  }
5331  }

5333  //============================================================================
5334  // Method Description:
5345  template<typename dtype>
5346  NdArray<dtype> nanmedian(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5347  {
5348  switch (inAxis)
5349  {
5350  case Axis::NONE:
5351  {
5352  std::vector<dtype> values;
5353  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
5354  {
5355  if (!std::isnan(inArray[i]))
5356  {
5357  values.push_back(inArray[i]);
5358  }
5359  }
5360 
5361  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5362  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5363  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { values[middle] };
5364 
5365  return std::move(returnArray);
5366  }
5367  case Axis::COL:
5368  {
5369  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5370  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5371  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5372  {
5373  std::vector<dtype> values;
5374  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5375  {
5376  if (!std::isnan(inArray(row, col)))
5377  {
5378  values.push_back(inArray(row, col));
5379  }
5380  }
5381 
5382  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5383  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5384  returnArray(0, row) = values[middle];
5385  }
5386 
5387  return std::move(returnArray);
5388  }
5389  case Axis::ROW:
5390  {
5391  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5392  Shape inShape = transposedArray.shape();
5393  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5394  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5395  {
5396  std::vector<dtype> values;
5397  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5398  {
5399  if (!std::isnan(transposedArray(row, col)))
5400  {
5401  values.push_back(transposedArray(row, col));
5402  }
5403  }
5404 
5405  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5406  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5407  returnArray(0, row) = values[middle];
5408  }
5409 
5410  return std::move(returnArray);
5411  }
5412  default:
5413  {
5414  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5415  // of the compiler warning.
5416  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
5417  }
5418  }
5419  }

5448  //============================================================================
5449  // Method Description:
5461  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
5462  NdArray<double> nanpercentile(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double inPercentile, Axis inAxis, const std::string& inInterpMethod)
5463  {
5464  if (inPercentile < 0 || inPercentile > 100)
5465  {
5466  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input percentile value must be of the range [0, 100].";
5467  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
5468  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
5469  }
5470 
5471  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") != 0 &&
5472  inInterpMethod.compare("lower") != 0 &&
5473  inInterpMethod.compare("higher") != 0 &&
5474  inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") != 0 &&
5475  inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") != 0)
5476  {
5477  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input interpolation method is not a vaid option.\n";
5478  errStr += "\tValid options are 'linear', 'lower', 'higher', 'nearest', 'midpoint'.";
5479  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
5480  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
5481  }
5482 
5483  switch (inAxis)
5484  {
5485  case Axis::NONE:
5486  {
5487  if (inPercentile == 0)
5488  {
5489  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
5490  {
5491  if (!isnan(inArray[i]))
5492  {
5493  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(inArray[i]) };
5494  return std::move(returnArray);
5495  }
5496  }
5497  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5498  }
5499  else if (inPercentile == 1)
5500  {
5501  for (int32 i = static_cast<int32>(inArray.size()) - 1; i > -1; --i)
5502  {
5503  if (!isnan(inArray[i]))
5504  {
5505  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(inArray[i]) };
5506  return std::move(returnArray);
5507  }
5508  }
5509  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5510  }
5511 
5512  std::vector<double> arrayCopy;
5513  uint32 numNonNan = 0;
5514  for (uint32 j = 0; j < inArray.size(); ++j)
5515  {
5516  if (!isnan(inArray[j]))
5517  {
5518  arrayCopy.push_back(inArray[j]);
5519  ++numNonNan;
5520  }
5521  }
5522 
5523  if (arrayCopy.size() < 2)
5524  {
5525  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5526  }
5527 
5528  int32 i = static_cast<int32>(std::floor(static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1) * inPercentile / 100.0));
5529  uint32 indexLower = static_cast<uint32>(clip<uint32>(i, 0, numNonNan - 2));
5530 
5531  std::sort(arrayCopy.begin(), arrayCopy.end());
5532 
5533  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") == 0)
5534  {
5535  double percentI = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5536  double fraction = (inPercentile / 100.0 - percentI) /
5537  (static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1) - percentI);
5538 
5539  double returnValue = arrayCopy[indexLower] + (arrayCopy[indexLower + 1] - arrayCopy[indexLower]) * fraction;
5540  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(returnValue) };
5541  return std::move(returnArray);
5542  }
5543  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("lower") == 0)
5544  {
5545  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
5546  return std::move(returnArray);
5547  }
5548  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("higher") == 0)
5549  {
5550  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
5551  return std::move(returnArray);
5552  }
5553  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") == 0)
5554  {
5555  double percent = inPercentile / 100.0;
5556  double percent1 = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5557  double percent2 = static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5558  double diff1 = percent - percent1;
5559  double diff2 = percent2 - percent;
5560 
5561  switch (argmin<double>({ diff1, diff2 }).item())
5562  {
5563  case 0:
5564  {
5565  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
5566  return std::move(returnArray);
5567  }
5568  case 1:
5569  {
5570  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
5571  return std::move(returnArray);
5572  }
5573  }
5574  }
5575  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") == 0)
5576  {
5577  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { (arrayCopy[indexLower] + arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) / 2.0 };
5578  return std::move(returnArray);
5579  }
5580  }
5581  case Axis::COL:
5582  {
5583  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5584 
5585  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5586  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5587  {
5588  NdArray<dtypeOut> outValue = nanpercentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row)),
5589  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod);
5590 
5591  if (outValue.size() == 1)
5592  {
5593  returnArray[row] = outValue.item();
5594  }
5595  else
5596  {
5597  returnArray[row] = Constants::nan;
5598  }
5599  }
5600 
5601  return std::move(returnArray);
5602  }
5603  case Axis::ROW:
5604  {
5605  NdArray<dtype> arrayTrans = inArray.transpose();
5606  Shape inShape = arrayTrans.shape();
5607 
5608  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5609  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5610  {
5611  NdArray<dtypeOut> outValue = nanpercentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(arrayTrans.cbegin(row), arrayTrans.cend(row)),
5612  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod);
5613 
5614  if (outValue.size() == 1)
5615  {
5616  returnArray[row] = outValue.item();
5617  }
5618  else
5619  {
5620  returnArray[row] = Constants::nan;
5621  }
5622  }
5623 
5624  return std::move(returnArray);
5625  }
5626  default:
5627  {
5628  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5629  // of the compiler warning.
5630  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5631  }
5632  }
5633  }
5634 
5635  //============================================================================
5636  // Method Description:
5647  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
5648  NdArray<dtypeOut> nanprod(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5649  {
5650  NdArray<dtype> arrayCopy(inArray);
5651  for (uint32 i = 0; i < arrayCopy.size(); ++i)
5652  {
5653  if (std::isnan(arrayCopy[i]))
5654  {
5655  arrayCopy[i] = 1;
5656  }
5657  }
5658 
5659  return std::move(prod<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy, inAxis));
5660  }

5727  //============================================================================
5728  // Method Description:
5739  template<typename dtype>
5740  NdArray<double> nanstd(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5741  {
5742  switch (inAxis)
5743  {
5744  case Axis::NONE:
5745  {
5746  double meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis).item();
5747  double sum = 0;
5748  double counter = 0;
5749  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
5750  {
5751  if (std::isnan(inArray[i]))
5752  {
5753  continue;
5754  }
5755 
5756  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(inArray[i]) - meanValue);
5757  ++counter;
5758  }
5759  NdArray<double> returnArray = { std::sqrt(sum / counter) };
5760  return std::move(returnArray);
5761  }
5762  case Axis::COL:
5763  {
5764  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5765  NdArray<double> meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis);
5766  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5767  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5768  {
5769  double sum = 0;
5770  double counter = 0;
5771  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5772  {
5773  if (std::isnan(inArray(row, col)))
5774  {
5775  continue;
5776  }
5777 
5778  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col)) - meanValue[row]);
5779  ++counter;
5780  }
5781  returnArray(0, row) = std::sqrt(sum / counter);
5782  }
5783 
5784  return std::move(returnArray);
5785  }
5786  case Axis::ROW:
5787  {
5788  NdArray<double> meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis);
5789  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5790  Shape inShape = transposedArray.shape();
5791  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5792  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5793  {
5794  double sum = 0;
5795  double counter = 0;
5796  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5797  {
5798  if (std::isnan(transposedArray(row, col)))
5799  {
5800  continue;
5801  }
5802 
5803  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(transposedArray(row, col)) - meanValue[row]);
5804  ++counter;
5805  }
5806  returnArray(0, row) = std::sqrt(sum / counter);
5807  }
5808 
5809  return std::move(returnArray);
5810  }
5811  default:
5812  {
5813  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5814  // of the compiler warning.
5815  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
5816  }
5817  }
5818  }
5819

5832  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
5833  NdArray<dtypeOut> nansum(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5834  {
5835  NdArray<dtype> arrayCopy(inArray);
5836  for (uint32 i = 0; i < arrayCopy.size(); ++i)
5837  {
5838  if (std::isnan(arrayCopy[i]))
5839  {
5840  arrayCopy[i] = 0;
5841  }
5842  }
5843 
5844  return std::move(sum<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy, inAxis));
5845  }

6120  //============================================================================
6121  // Method Description:
6138  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
6139  NdArray<dtypeOut> percentile(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double inPercentile, Axis inAxis, const std::string& inInterpMethod)
6140  {
6141  if (inPercentile < 0 || inPercentile > 100)
6142  {
6143  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input percentile value must be of the range [0, 100].";
6144  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
6145  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
6146  }
6147 
6148  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") != 0 &&
6149  inInterpMethod.compare("lower") != 0 &&
6150  inInterpMethod.compare("higher") != 0 &&
6151  inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") != 0 &&
6152  inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") != 0)
6153  {
6154  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input interpolation method is not a vaid option.\n";
6155  errStr += "\tValid options are 'linear', 'lower', 'higher', 'nearest', 'midpoint'.";
6156  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
6157  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
6158  }
6159 
6160  switch (inAxis)
6161  {
6162  case Axis::NONE:
6163  {
6164  if (inPercentile == 0)
6165  {
6166  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(*inArray.cbegin()) };
6167  return std::move(returnArray);
6168  }
6169  else if (inPercentile == 1)
6170  {
6171  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(*inArray.cend()) };
6172  return std::move(returnArray);
6173  }
6174 
6175  int32 i = static_cast<int32>(std::floor(static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1) * inPercentile / 100.0));
6176  uint32 indexLower = static_cast<uint32>(clip<uint32>(i, 0, inArray.size() - 2));
6177 
6178  NdArray<double> arrayCopy = inArray.template astype<double>();
6179  std::sort(arrayCopy.begin(), arrayCopy.end());
6180 
6181  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") == 0)
6182  {
6183  double percentI = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6184  double fraction = (inPercentile / 100.0 - percentI) /
6185  (static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1) - percentI);
6186 
6187  double returnValue = arrayCopy[indexLower] + (arrayCopy[indexLower + 1] - arrayCopy[indexLower]) * fraction;
6188  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(returnValue) };
6189  return std::move(returnArray);
6190  }
6191  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("lower") == 0)
6192  {
6193  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
6194  return std::move(returnArray);
6195  }
6196  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("higher") == 0)
6197  {
6198  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
6199  return std::move(returnArray);
6200  }
6201  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") == 0)
6202  {
6203  double percent = inPercentile / 100.0;
6204  double percent1 = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6205  double percent2 = static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6206  double diff1 = percent - percent1;
6207  double diff2 = percent2 - percent;
6208 
6209  switch (argmin<double>({ diff1, diff2 }).item())
6210  {
6211  case 0:
6212  {
6213  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
6214  return std::move(returnArray);
6215  }
6216  case 1:
6217  {
6218  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
6219  return std::move(returnArray);
6220  }
6221  }
6222  }
6223  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") == 0)
6224  {
6225  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>((arrayCopy[indexLower] + arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) / 2.0) };
6226  return std::move(returnArray);
6227  }
6228  }
6229  case Axis::COL:
6230  {
6231  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6232 
6233  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6234  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6235  {
6236  returnArray[row] = percentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row)),
6237  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod).item();
6238  }
6239 
6240  return std::move(returnArray);
6241  }
6242  case Axis::ROW:
6243  {
6244  NdArray<dtype> arrayTrans = inArray.transpose();
6245  Shape inShape = arrayTrans.shape();
6246 
6247  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6248  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6249  {
6250  returnArray[row] = percentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(arrayTrans.cbegin(row), arrayTrans.cend(row)),
6251  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod).item();
6252  }
6253 
6254  return std::move(returnArray);
6255  }
6256  default:
6257  {
6258  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6259  // of the compiler warning.
6260  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
6261  }
6262  }
6263  }
6264

6529  //============================================================================
6530  // Method Description:
6541  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
6542  NdArray<dtypeOut> remainder(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2)
6543  {
6544  if (inArray1.shape() != inArray2.shape())
6545  {
6546  std::string errStr = "ERROR: remainder: input array shapes are not consistant.";
6547  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
6548  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
6549  }
6550 
6551  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(inArray1.shape());
6552  std::transform(inArray1.cbegin(), inArray1.cend(), inArray2.cbegin(), returnArray.begin(),
6553  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::remainder(static_cast<dtypeOut>(inValue1), static_cast<dtypeOut>(inValue2)); });
6554 
6555  return std::move(returnArray);
6556  }

6777  //============================================================================
6778  // Method Description:
6790  template<typename dtype>
6791  NdArray<dtype> roll(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, int32 inShift, Axis inAxis)
6792  {
6793  switch (inAxis)
6794  {
6795  case Axis::NONE:
6796  {
6797  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inArray.size();
6798  if (inShift > 0)
6799  {
6800  shift = inArray.size() - shift;
6801  }
6802 
6803  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
6804  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(), returnArray.begin() + shift, returnArray.end());
6805 
6806  return std::move(returnArray);
6807  }
6808  case Axis::COL:
6809  {
6810  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6811 
6812  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inShape.cols;
6813  if (inShift > 0)
6814  {
6815  shift = inShape.cols - shift;
6816  }
6817 
6818  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
6819  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6820  {
6821  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.begin(row) + shift, returnArray.end(row));
6822  }
6823 
6824  return std::move(returnArray);
6825  }
6826  case Axis::ROW:
6827  {
6828  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6829 
6830  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inShape.rows;
6831  if (inShift > 0)
6832  {
6833  shift = inShape.rows - shift;
6834  }
6835 
6836  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = inArray.transpose();
6837  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.cols; ++row)
6838  {
6839  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.begin(row) + shift, returnArray.end(row));
6840  }
6841 
6842  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
6843  }
6844  default:
6845  {
6846  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6847  // of the compiler warning.
6848  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
6849  }
6850  }
6851  }
6852 
6853  //============================================================================
6854  // Method Description:
6865  template<typename dtype>
6866  NdArray<dtype> rot90(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint8 inK)
6867  {
6868  inK %= 4;
6869  switch (inK)
6870  {
6871  case 1:
6872  {
6873  return std::move(flipud(inArray.transpose()));
6874  }
6875  case 2:
6876  {
6877  return std::move(flip(inArray, Axis::NONE));
6878  }
6879  case 3:
6880  {
6881  return std::move(fliplr(inArray.transpose()));
6882  }
6883  default:
6884  {
6885  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6886  // of the compiler warning.
6887  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
6888  }
6889  }
6890  }

6925  //============================================================================
6926  // Method Description:
6935  template<typename dtype>
6936  NdArray<dtype> row_stack(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList)
6937  {
6938  // first loop through to calculate the final size of the array
6939  typename std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >::iterator iter;
6940  Shape finalShape;
6941  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
6942  {
6943  if (finalShape.isnull())
6944  {
6945  finalShape = iter->shape();
6946  }
6947  else if (iter->shape().cols != finalShape.cols)
6948  {
6949  std::string errStr = "ERROR: row_stack: input arrays must have the same number of columns.";
6950  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
6951  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
6952  }
6953  else
6954  {
6955  finalShape.rows += iter->shape().rows;
6956  }
6957  }
6958 
6959  // now that we know the final size, contruct the output array
6960  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(finalShape);
6961  uint32 rowStart = 0;
6962  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
6963  {
6964  Shape theShape = iter->shape();
6965  for (uint32 row = 0; row < theShape.rows; ++row)
6966  {
6967  for (uint32 col = 0; col < theShape.cols; ++col)
6968  {
6969  returnArray(rowStart + row, col) = iter->operator()(row, col);
6970  }
6971  }
6972  rowStart += theShape.rows;
6973  }
6974 
6975  return std::move(returnArray);
6976  }

6978  //============================================================================
6979  // Method Description:
6991  template<typename dtype>
6992  NdArray<dtype> setdiff1d(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2)
6993  {
6994  std::vector<dtype> res(inArray1.size() + inArray2.size());
6995  std::set<dtype> in1(inArray1.cbegin(), inArray1.cend());
6996  std::set<dtype> in2(inArray2.cbegin(), inArray2.cend());
6997 
6998  typename std::vector<dtype>::iterator iter = std::set_difference(in1.begin(), in1.end(),
6999  in2.begin(), in2.end(), res.begin());
7000  res.resize(iter - res.begin());
7001  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(res));
7002  }

7596  //============================================================================
7597  // Method Description:
7609  template<typename dtype>
7610  NdArray<double> trapz(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double dx, Axis inAxis)
7611  {
7612  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
7613  switch (inAxis)
7614  {
7615  case Axis::COL:
7616  {
7617  NdArray<double> returnArray(inShape.rows, 1);
7618  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
7619  {
7620  double sum = 0;
7621  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols - 1; ++col)
7622  {
7623  sum += static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col + 1) - inArray(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col));
7624  }
7625 
7626  returnArray[row] = sum * dx;
7627  }
7628 
7629  return std::move(returnArray);
7630  }
7631  case Axis::ROW:
7632  {
7633  NdArray<dtype> arrayTranspose = inArray.transpose();
7634  Shape transShape = arrayTranspose.shape();
7635  NdArray<double> returnArray(transShape.rows, 1);
7636  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
7637  {
7638  double sum = 0;
7639  for (uint32 col = 0; col < transShape.cols - 1; ++col)
7640  {
7641  sum += static_cast<double>(arrayTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayTranspose(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(arrayTranspose(row, col));
7642  }
7643 
7644  returnArray[row] = sum * dx;
7645  }
7646 
7647  return std::move(returnArray);
7648  }
7649  case Axis::NONE:
7650  {
7651  double sum = 0.0;
7652  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size() - 1; ++i)
7653  {
7654  sum += static_cast<double>(inArray[i + 1] - inArray[i]) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArray[i]);
7655  }
7656 
7657  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum * dx };
7658  return std::move(returnArray);
7659  }
7660  default:
7661  {
7662  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
7663  // of the compiler warning.
7664  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
7665  }
7666  }
7667  }
7668 
7669  //============================================================================
7670  // Method Description:
7682  template<typename dtype>
7683  NdArray<double> trapz(const NdArray<dtype>& inArrayY, const NdArray<dtype>& inArrayX, Axis inAxis)
7684  {
7685  Shape inShapeY = inArrayY.shape();
7686  Shape inShapeX = inArrayX.shape();
7687 
7688  if (inShapeY != inShapeX)
7689  {
7690  std::string errStr = "ERROR: trapz: input x and y arrays should be the same shape.";
7691  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
7692  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
7693  }
7694 
7695  switch (inAxis)
7696  {
7697  case Axis::COL:
7698  {
7699  NdArray<double> returnArray(inShapeY.rows, 1);
7700  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShapeY.rows; ++row)
7701  {
7702  double sum = 0;
7703  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShapeY.cols - 1; ++col)
7704  {
7705  double dx = static_cast<double>(inArrayX(row, col + 1) - inArrayX(row, col));
7706  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(inArrayY(row, col + 1) - inArrayY(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArrayY(row, col)));
7707  }
7708 
7709  returnArray[row] = sum;
7710  }
7711 
7712  return std::move(returnArray);
7713  }
7714  case Axis::ROW:
7715  {
7716  NdArray<dtype> arrayYTranspose = inArrayY.transpose();
7717  NdArray<dtype> arrayXTranspose = inArrayX.transpose();
7718  Shape transShape = arrayYTranspose.shape();
7719  NdArray<double> returnArray(transShape.rows, 1);
7720  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
7721  {
7722  double sum = 0;
7723  for (uint32 col = 0; col < transShape.cols - 1; ++col)
7724  {
7725  double dx = static_cast<double>(arrayXTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayXTranspose(row, col));
7726  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(arrayYTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayYTranspose(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(arrayYTranspose(row, col)));
7727  }
7728 
7729  returnArray[row] = sum;
7730  }
7731 
7732  return std::move(returnArray);
7733  }
7734  case Axis::NONE:
7735  {
7736  double sum = 0.0;
7737  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArrayY.size() - 1; ++i)
7738  {
7739  double dx = static_cast<double>(inArrayX[i + 1] - inArrayX[i]);
7740  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(inArrayY[i + 1] - inArrayY[i]) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArrayY[i]));
7741  }
7742 
7743  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum };
7744  return std::move(returnArray);
7745  }
7746  default:
7747  {
7748  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
7749  // of the compiler warning.
7750  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
7751  }
7752  }
7753  }
7754

7756  // Method Description:
7768  template<typename dtype>
7769  NdArray<dtype> tril(uint32 inN, int32 inOffset)
7770  {
7771  uint32 rowStart = 0;
7772  uint32 colStart = 0;
7773  if (inOffset > 0)
7774  {
7775  colStart = inOffset;
7776  }
7777  else
7778  {
7779  rowStart = inOffset * -1;
7780  }
7781 
7782  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inN);
7783  returnArray.zeros();
7784  for (uint32 row = rowStart; row < inN; ++row)
7785  {
7786  for (uint32 col = 0; col < row + colStart + 1 - rowStart; ++col)
7787  {
7788  if (col == inN)
7789  {
7790  break;
7791  }
7792 
7793  returnArray(row, col) = static_cast<dtype>(1);
7794  }
7795  }
7796 
7797  return std::move(returnArray);
7798  }

7966  //============================================================================
7967  // Method Description:
7978  template<typename dtype>
7979  NdArray<dtype> trim_zeros(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const std::string inTrim)
7980  {
7981  if (inTrim == "f")
7982  {
7983  uint32 place = 0;
7984  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
7985  {
7986  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
7987  {
7988  break;
7989  }
7990  else
7991  {
7992  ++place;
7993  }
7994  }
7995 
7996  if (place == inArray.size())
7997  {
7998  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
7999  }
8000 
8001  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() - place);
8002  std::copy(inArray.cbegin() + place, inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
8003 
8004  return std::move(returnArray);
8005  }
8006  else if (inTrim == "b")
8007  {
8008  uint32 place = inArray.size();
8009  for (uint32 i = inArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i)
8010  {
8011  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8012  {
8013  break;
8014  }
8015  else
8016  {
8017  --place;
8018  }
8019  }
8020 
8021  if (place == 0 || (place == 1 && inArray[0] == 0))
8022  {
8023  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8024  }
8025 
8026  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, place);
8027  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cbegin() + place, returnArray.begin());
8028 
8029  return std::move(returnArray);
8030  }
8031  else if (inTrim == "fb")
8032  {
8033  uint32 placeBegin = 0;
8034  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
8035  {
8036  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8037  {
8038  break;
8039  }
8040  else
8041  {
8042  ++placeBegin;
8043  }
8044  }
8045 
8046  if (placeBegin == inArray.size())
8047  {
8048  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8049  }
8050 
8051  uint32 placeEnd = inArray.size();
8052  for (uint32 i = inArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i)
8053  {
8054  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8055  {
8056  break;
8057  }
8058  else
8059  {
8060  --placeEnd;
8061  }
8062  }
8063 
8064  if (placeEnd == 0 || (placeEnd == 1 && inArray[0] == 0))
8065  {
8066  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8067  }
8068 
8069  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, placeEnd - placeBegin);
8070  std::copy(inArray.cbegin() + placeBegin, inArray.cbegin() + placeEnd, returnArray.begin());
8071 
8072  return std::move(returnArray);
8073  }
8074  else
8075  {
8076  std::string errStr = "ERROR: trim_zeros: trim options are 'f' = front, 'b' = back, 'fb' = front and back.";
8077  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8078  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8079  }
8080  }

8184  template<typename dtype>
8185  dtype unwrap(dtype inValue)
8186  {
8187  if (inValue < 0)
8188  {
8189  return inValue + 2 * Constants::pi;
8190  }
8191  else if (inValue >= 2 * Constants::pi)
8192  {
8193  return inValue - 2 * Constants::pi;
8194  }
8195  else
8196  {
8197  return inValue;
8198  }
8199  }

8260  // Method Description:
8272  template<typename dtype>
8273  NdArray<dtype> where(const NdArray<bool>& inMask, const NdArray<dtype>& inA, const NdArray<dtype>& inB)
8274  {
8275  auto shapeMask = inMask.shape();
8276  auto shapeA = inA.shape();
8277  if (shapeA != inB.shape())
8278  {
8279  std::string errStr = "ERROR: where: input inA and inB must be the same shapes.";
8280  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8281  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8282  }
8283 
8284  if (shapeMask != shapeA)
8285  {
8286  std::string errStr = "ERROR: where: input inMask must be the same shape as the input arrays.";
8287  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8288  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8289  }
8290 
8291  auto outArray = NdArray<dtype>(shapeMask);
8292 
8293  for (uint32 i = 0; i < shapeMask.size(); ++i)
8294  {
8295  if (inMask[i])
8296  {
8297  outArray[i] = inA[i];
8298  }
8299  else
8300  {
8301  outArray[i] = inB[i];
8302  }
8303  }
8304 
8305  return std::move(outArray);
8306  }
